title: Meeting of South West RSE’s in Bristol
text:
Monday 23 June 2025, 10am – 3:30pm (refreshments from 9:30am for a 10am start) Room LG.02, Fry Building, Woodland Road, Bristol, BS8 1UG (How to get here)
Registration is closed

title: Meeting of South West RSE’s in Bristol
text:
Purpose
Following a successful event at the Met Office in February, the University of Bristol is hosting a further meeting on Monday 23 June. It will be another day to showcase interesting topics, share knowledge and build networks. It aims to complement the annual RSE conference and be useful to those in the South West / GW4 who are not part of a larger RSE group.
All are welcome, whether or not you are from the South West of the UK, and whether or not you self-define as a Research Software Engineer (RSE).

title: Meeting of South West RSE’s in Bristol
text:
Agenda



09:30

Refreshments on arrival


10:00

Welcome James Thomas, Rachel Tunnicliffe, Rita Rasteiro, Léo Gorman


Introductions from the different groups attending

Introduction to Padlet for the afternoon discussion session



10:20

Keynote Fliss Guest Vice President of the Society of Research Software Engineering Deputy Head of Research Software Engineering at the University of Exeter


11:00

Networking and refreshments


11:15

Session 1: Groups and facilities


How can University IT departments support RSEs to deliver and share better research software? Polly Eccleston


TBC Invited speaker


11:55

Lightning talks (5 minutes)


Research IT Facility at the University of Bristol Serena Cooper


Developing & Deploying Conceptual Design Tools for Factory Planning Lewis Gilbert


The Isambard supercomputers Matt Williams


12:30

Group photo


12:40

Lunch and optional walk/viewing tower


13:50

Start of afternoon session


Work on Padlet for the afternoon discussion session


14:00

Session 2: Applications


Mapping the March: an RSE’s adventures in time and space Mike Jones


14:20

Lightning talks (5 minutes)


How do you host translated content within a Django application? Benjamin O’Driscoll


Support for the Python array API standard in SciPy Jake Bowhay


Make make great again James Frost


14:50

Discussion session (Padlet link) Rachel Tunnicliffe


The future of RSE South West events

RSE groups and how they’re organised

RSE best practices



15:20

Closing remarks James Thomas, Rachel Tunnicliffe, Rita Rasteiro, Léo Gorman


15:30

End of day and optional pub trip

title: Meeting of South West RSE’s in Bristol
text:
Code of conduct
All participants are expected to adhere to the Society of RSE code of conduct for events.

title: Meeting of South West RSE’s in Bristol
section: Contact the organisers and other attendees
text:
Contact the organisers and other attendees
The easiest way to communicate with everyone is via the #rse-south-west channel on the UK RSE Slack instance.
If you would rather send us an email, please contact: rse-south-west-2025@bristol.ac.uk.
